title: Day 18: The one without words, only pictures
author: Dan

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body:
flippin excellent
a part of me (the rebellious part) wants to flip one of those other breakers to see what will happen.... but i promise i wont.. as long as i can have my birthday party at the moxie this year

comments.author: Sam Spade
comments.body:
It's really coming together now. Nice column accents on the archways, but it looks like another coat of red is needed.

What's the heavy duty outlet next to the panel for?

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Un.  Frickin.  Believable.

Great job.  On Everything.

My new home has red walls in the living room, very similar to this shade, and the seller made a point to tell me that, in the future, should I ever decide to paint with red, "it takes, like, five coats to get even."

Frankly though I think your red looks great now.

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body: I, too, am loving the archway column accents. Very spiffy. It's really looking great.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body:
Sam: that's the old outlet for a wash that was back there.

Yes, red takes many coats to even out. I'm thinking we're going to need one more to make it perfect.

comments.author: erin
comments.body: NO CAPTIONS???? dan dan dan... what are we going to do with you?

comments.author: hmmm....
comments.body: What are you doing with the floors?  Also, are you putting anything in the theater room for sound absorption or will the curtain be enough?

comments.author: Mark
comments.body:
Hey, it's starting to look like something and it looks like a great something!

M

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: hum: the curtains will add some sound absorption, the chairs will add some more, the people will add some, and the acoustical drop ceiling with 6" of audio batting will take care of the rest.
